message:
When I was a kid going to summer camp in New York’s Adirondack Mountains, I counted myself lucky if I saw a black bear once or twice in a season. But

‎"... campers may soon be able to regularly see something bigger & badder when climbing the High Peaks: Reaper drones flown by the New York Air National Guard’s 174th Fighter Wing based in Syracuse, New York... The proposal to begin training missions there is part of a bigger push to build a drone infrastructure for flying missions throughout the United States."

http://www.wired.com/dangerroom/2011/02/drones-set-to-invade-u-s-national-parks/
